titleInfo.title: Letter from James Henderson, Secretary to the Government, Political Department, Bombay to Lieutenant William Bruce, Resident at Bushire

mods.abstract: The letter is enclosing a communication from John Adam, Acting Chief Secretary to Government, to William Bruce, dated 28 December 1816, discussing the non-payment of charitable donations following the death of the Persian ambassador Kajuk Khulleel Khan.This letter in turn encloses a copy of a letter to the Court of Directors of the East India Company, dated 28 December 1816, signed by the Earl of Moira, Neil Benjamin Edmonstone, Archibald Seton and George Dowdeswell, giving detailed background of the question of Kajuk Khulleel Khan's estate and ultimately referring the case to the Court of Directors for a decision.
